result.execSummary:
The defendant Lashone T Jackson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Lashone T Jackson is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Lashone T Jackson was found guilty of Possess Firearm-Convicted of a Felony, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(1m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant is NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.  Defendant is NOT eligible for Substance Abuse Program.
Court will allow for transfer to Milwaukee County.

miscConds.notes: Cash bail on deposit to be applied to cost/surcharge.  Remaining balance to be refunded to poster.

Follow through with any assessments, evaluations, treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.  Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.  

Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

Court will order the firearm be returned to the lawfull owner.

timeConds.notes:
With Huber.  Standard release conditions.  Court will allow for transfer to Milwaukee County.  NO ELECTRONIC MONITORING UNTIL THE FIRST 6 MONTHS OF THE CONDITION TIME IS SERVED.  Court grants 4 days credit.  Defendant to report to Huber on 7/15/22 by 6 pm

08-24-2022 COURT GRANTS REQUEST FOR HUBER RELEASE TO BE 16 HOURS A DAY FOR 6 DAYS A WEEK FOR CHILD CARE AND EMPLOYMENT.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lashone T Jackson

records.addlTxt:
Letter dated 08/22/2022, filed by Atty Hughes, Request to Increase Time Out on Huber

**Reviewed by Judge Carter on 08/23/2022 - Approved.**
Letter from Atty Hughes advising the Office of the State Public Defender no longer represents Defendant.

District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Jack Rieder, appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant Lashone T Jackson in court with attorney Steven Hughes.   
Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office.

Defendant enters a plea of Guilty to count 2.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of count 2.
Count 3 is dismissed as read ins.

FELONY WARANINGS PROVIDED:  REGARDING VOTING AND FIREARMS RESTRICTIONS.


Court orders the following:
IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE FOR PROBATION.
Total Prison:  6 Years.
Initial Confinement:  3 Years.
Extended Supervision:  3 Years.
STAYED.  

IF REVOKED:  
Defendant is NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is NOT eligible for Substance Abuse Program.  


Term of Probation:  2 Years.
Court will allow for transfer to Milwaukee County.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
Follow through with any assessments, evaluations, treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent; 
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done.


COSTS:  $268
DNA SAMPLE AND SURCHARGE:  $ 250
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
Apply Bail - Balance to be refunded to the posting party.

CONDITION TIME: 
12 Months Jail w/huber (all standard release conditions).
Court will allow for transfer to Milwaukee County - NO ELECTRONIC MONITORING UNTIL THE FIRST 6 MONTHS OF THE CONDITION TIME IS SERVED.
4 Days Credit.
Defendant to report to Mail Jail to serve his huber on 07/15/22 by 6 pm..



COURT WILL ORDER THE FIREARM BE RETURNED TO THE LAWFULL OWNER.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 7, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

08:44 AM District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Charlie Hoffman, appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Lashone T Jackson in court with attorney Steven Hughes.   
Defense acknowledges receipt of Information and waives reading.  
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
Defense has received most of discovery.
Defense requests a plea and sentencing date.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 7, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

When pulling through the Information from CCAP, clerk noticed that Count 1 was still on the information even though Count 1 was dismissed during the initial.   Clerk reached out to the State and to file a new information.
Defendant waives his right to a Preliminary Hearing.

10:19 AM Defendant Lashone T Jackson in court with attorney Steven Hughes.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court finds that the Defendants waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary.  
Waive reading of Information.  
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  
Hearing scheduled for April 27, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on April 1, 2022 at 10:15 am.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Comply with all licensing restrictions.

03:23 PM Defendant Lashone T Jackson in court, in custody, with attorney Steven Hughes.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Atty. Hughes moves to dismiss theft count.  Case recalled with Attorney Patrick Campbell for the State of Wisconsin all other appearances are the same.  Atty. Campbell moves to dismiss as the firearms was stolen from Illinois, they do not know who it was stolen from yet.  Atty. Hughes moves to dismiss count #1 as the complaint does not list who the firearm was stolen from.  Court order count #1 dismissed without prejudice.  PRELIMINARY HEARING REQUESTED WITHIN 10 DAYS time limits waived until 4/1/2022.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 1, 2022 at 10:15 am.
Waukesha County Public Safety Assessment Report filed by Wisconsin Community Services.
